title: Luminary Close Look: Among Friends and Rivals—Caravaggio in Rome
title_display: Luminary Close Look: Among Friends and Rivals—Caravaggio in Rome
hero_caption: Michelangelo Merisi da Caravaggio. Martha and Mary Magdalene (detail), about 1598. Detroit Institute of Arts, gift of the Kresge Foundation and Mrs. Edsel B. Ford.
short_description:
Luminary are invited to connect with Rebecca Long, Patrick G. and Shirley W. Ryan Associate Curator of European Painting and Sculpture, in this examination of two rarely loaned paintings by Caravaggio.

Open exclusively to Luminary members, this event requires advance registration and is limited to 20 participants.
list_description: Luminary are invited to connect with Rebecca Long, Patrick G. and Shirley W. Ryan Associate Curator of European Painting and Sculpture, in this examination of two rarely loaned paintings by Caravaggio.
description:
Join Patrick G. and Shirley W. Ryan Associate Curator of European Painting and Sculpture Rebecca Long to hear the secrets behind two spectacular and rarely loaned paintings by Caravaggio featured in Among Friends and Rivals: Caravaggio in Rome.

This focused installation showcases the captivating drama of the Italian master's artistic vision and the magnitude of his influence on other artists—both of which forever altered the narrative power of painting.

Open exclusively to Luminary members, this event requires advance registration and is limited to 20 participants.

Please note that this event occurs when the museum is closed to the public, and guests should use the Michigan Avenue entrance.

Contact Us

buy_button_caption: $35 per person. Contact luminary@artic.edu to register.
